      • DrwImage

        double posX,
        double posY,
        double width,
        double height,
        javax.swing.JPanel panel,
        java.lang.String name)
        This constructor is used by SimpleGUI.
        Parameters:
        filename -
        posX -
        posY -
        width - if 0: use image width, -1: use panel width, other: scale image
        height - if 0: use image height, -1: use panel height, other: scale image

      • DrwImage

        public DrwImage(java.lang.String filename)
        This constructor can be used to read an image for processing without displaying. An image read/processed can then be displayed using SimpleGUI.drawImage(img,...);
        Parameters:
        filename -

    • Method Detail

      • draw

        protected void draw(java.awt.Graphics2D g)
        Specified by:
        draw in class AbstractDrawable

      • getWidth

        public int getWidth()
        Return (unscaled) width of the physical image (i.e. the BufferedImage), NOT the displayed image!
        Returns:
        width

      • getHeight

        public int getHeight()
        Return (unscaled) height of the physical image (i.e. the BufferedImage), NOT the displayed image!
        Returns:
        height

      • setPixelRGB

        public void setPixelRGB(int x,
               int y,
               int r,
               int g,
               int b)
        Set pixel at (x,y) to color (RGB) All r,g,b values in 0..255 Please note that operations on the image do NOT call repaint on the panel. In order to make the effect visible, panel.repaint() has to be called.
        Parameters:
        x - column (bounds are tested)
        y - row (bounds are tested) 0 = top row.
        r - (0..255)
        g - (0..255)
        b - (0..255)

      • setPixelRGB

        public void setPixelRGB(int x,
               int y,
               RGB rgb)

      • getPixelRGB

        public RGB getPixelRGB(int x,
              int y)
        get RGB value at (x,y). Returns null if x,y is out of bounds.
        Parameters:
        x - column (bounds are tested)
        y - row (bounds are tested) 0 = top row.
        Returns:
        RGB object. Retrieve r,g,b values from respective fields in RGB.
